Posts.Content: kimmer07 wrote: I have a dense mass in one breast that I have recently noticed.  I went to my doctor and due to my age and family history (only one grandma with breast cancer at the age of 85), she thought it was a cyst or fibroadenoma.  I went for a mammogram and they also did an ultrasound.  The radiologist told me there was no tumor, which I can believe, but he said it was just an area of dense breast tissue.  I have difficulty believing that, how does dense tissue suddenly develop and why would it feel more like a lump or mass?  He did not think it was any of the other types of breast lumps, when it clearly feels like a lump.  He didn't do an exam, but just looked at the ultrasound images and the mammogram.  He said to bring it up with my doctor if it started to get harder.  So, I am I just supposed to live with this lump? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: misdiagnosed?? kimmer07 taraleec
